articles.title: Stone Age Time Capsule: West Africa's Oldest Occupied Site Unearths 150,000 Years of History - SciTechDaily
articles.description: A recent study reveals the oldest directly dated archaeological site in West Africa, extending the known timeframe of Middle Stone Age toolkits in the region to 150,000 years ago. The findings highlight the long-term durability of core elements of Middle Ston…
articles.content:
ByMax Planck Institute of GeoanthropologyMay 4, 2023
A core from the Middle Stone Age stone tool assemblage from the near-coastal site of Bargny 1. Credit: Khady Niang
